page.title: 07INTERVIEWS WITH OLD FOLK (1)
page.content: "Cirencester is the most useful town to us old people, but many can only use the village shops through lack of transport. The buses are a problem - they're expensive and they don't come very often. Some of the village shops are good, but they can be expensive and without much choice. "There's a lot of entertainment in the village: clubs, Mothers' Union, and amateur dramatics in the Village Hall. It's just as well, because in the evening it's almost impossible to get into Cirencester or Swindon without your own transport. Some of the clubs are specially for the old people, but many of us like to mix with younger friends. The churches are important for many old folk, and you can make many new friends there. "I don't mind all these new houses, but I think Cerney's big enough now."
